Oscars 2019: Period. End Of Sentence Producer Guneet Monga Is On Cloud Nine With Her Big Win
Oscars 2019: Period. End Of Sentence Producer Guneet Monga Is On Cloud Nine With Her Big Win
It’s a proud day for every Indian who’s passion is cinema as we made it to Oscars 2019, and even won the award. Guneet Monga the producer of Period. End of Sentence won the Best Documentary Short Film and we cannot be just more proud.
Also read: Oscars 2019: India-based 'Period. End of Sentence' Wins Best Documentary Short Award
Guneet is on cloud nine with her super win and took Twitter to share her excitement.
She writes, “WE WON!!! To every girl on this earth... know that you are a goddess... if heavens are listening... look MA we put @sikhya on the map”.
WE WON!!! To every girl on this earth... know that you are a goddess... if heavens are listening... look MA we put @sikhya on the map ❤️ — Guneet Monga (@guneetm) February 25, 2019
Period. End Of Sentence was competing with films like Black Sheep, End Game, Lifeboat And A Night At A Garden. But there is always one winner and this time it’s us.

The film is based on a taboo on the menstruation every Indian girl has to face especially in rural areas directed by award-winning Iranian- American filmmaker Rakya Zehtabchi.
